item.title: Ananya add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Ananya add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Fairies have to be one thing or the other, because being so small they unfortunately have room for one feeling only at a time." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I got lost in the night, without the light of your eyelids, and when the night surrounded me I was born again: I was the owner of my own darkness." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Rainer Marie Rilke
item.description: "Let life happen to you. Believe me: life is in the right, always." -- Rainer Marie Rilke

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up. You build up all these defenses, you build up a whole suit of armor, so that nothing can hurt you, then one stupid person, no different from any other stupid person, wanders into your stupid life...You give them a piece of you. They didn't ask for it. They did something dumb one day, like kiss you or smile at you, and then your life isn't your own anymore. Love takes hostages. It gets inside you. It eats you out and leaves you crying in the darkness, so simple a phrase like 'maybe we should be just friends' turns into a glass splinter working its way into your heart. It hurts. Not just in the imagination. Not just in the mind. It's a soul-hurt, a real gets-inside-you-and-rips-you-apart pain. I hate love." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "I have learned silence from the talkative, toleration from the intolerant, and kindness from the unkind; yet strange, I am ungrateful to these teachers." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Maybe you are searching among the branches, for what only appears in the roots." -- Rumi

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "You never know the answers to the questions of life until you are asked." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Alison McGhee
item.description: "You are most powerful when you are most silent. People never expect silence. They expect words, motion, defense, offense, back and forth. They expect to leap into the fray. They are ready, fists up, words hanging leaping from their mouths. Silence? No." -- Alison McGhee

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Love is a fire/It burns everyone/It disfigures everyone/It is the world's excuse for being ugly." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "He couldn’t see why people made such a fuss about people eating their silly old fruit anyway, but life would be a lot less fun if they didn’t. And there was never an apple, in Adam’s opinion, that wasn’t worth the trouble you got into for eating it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "I could die for you. But I couldn't, and wouldn't, live for you." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "But still," Ayumi said, "it seems to me that this world has a serious shortage of both logic and kindness." "You may be right," Aomame said, "But it's too late to trade it in for another one." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Lewis Carroll
Ananya add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Mark Haddon
item.description: "Prime numbers are what is left when you have taken all the patterns away. I think prime numbers are like life. They are very logical but you could never work out the rules, even if you spent all your time thinking about them." -- Mark Haddon

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I will write in words of fire. I will write them on your skin. I will write about desire. Write beginnings, write of sin. You’re the book I love the best, your skin only holds my truth, you will be a palimpsest lines of age rewriting youth. You will not burn upon the pyre. Or be buried on the shelf. You’re my letter to desire: And you’ll never read yourself. I will trace each word and comma As the final dusk descends, You’re my tale of dreams and drama, Let us find out how it ends." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Ananya add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "The trouble is that we have a bad habit, encouraged by pendants and sophisticates, of considering happiness as something rather stupid. Only pain is intellectual, only evil interesting. This is the treason of the artist: a refusal to admit the banality of evil and the terrible boredom of pain." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Ananya add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You don’t pass or fail at being a human, dear." -- Neil Gaiman
